components.description: The letter E, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter E

components.description:
The letter U, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.

Previously this emoji incorrectly depicted the letter V when displayed in isolation on Samsung devices. This was corrected in January 2020.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter U

description: The flag for European Union, which may show as the letters EU on some platforms.
title: Flag: European Union

emoji_net_data.name: European Union

bn:00102440a: Of or relating to or characteristic of Europe or the people of Europe

bn:00034960n: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design

bn:00021127n: The 27 nations (Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czechia, Denmark, Estiona, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and the UK) that have joined together to form an economic community with common monetary, political and social aspirations.
The European geo within the Azure region taxonomy.
The European Union is an economic and political union or confederation of 27 member states which are located primarily in Europe. Union
The European Union is a politico-economic union of member states that are primarily located in Europe.
An international organization of European countries formed after World War II to reduce trade barriers and increase cooperation among its members

The union of European countries into one single market established under the Treaty of Rome in 1957. (Formerly known as the European Community or EC.) Directives have been developed to standardize member states in Europe into a common market by removing frontier fiscal barriers.
Cyprus, Czech Republic, Estonia, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Malta, Poland, Romania, Slovakia and Slovenia) to differ them from the so-called "Old Union" (consisting of the EU15)
An international organisation created by the Treaty of Rome of 1957
The European Economic Community was an international organization created by the Treaty of Rome of 1957.

A supranational organisation created in the 1950s to bring the nations of Europe into closer economic and political connection. As of 2013, 28 member nations are Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, The Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom.
European Community (1993-2009), formerly known as the EEC.
European Economic Community, has now been replaced with EU, European Union.
Former name of the European Economic Community.

note: This emoji was found in merged_emojis_before_fluentui but not in FluentUI
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the European Union flag emoji is rendered with striking clarity, its twelve golden stars arranged in a circle on a deep blue background. Apple's meticulous attention to detail ensures the stars are sharp and the blue has a smooth, almost velvety gradient, conveying a sense of unity and aspiration. This emoji serves as a direct symbol of the European Union, its values, and its member states, appearing prominently in discussions about politics, travel, and international relations.
